How to Install genext2fs on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • genext2fs

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install genext2fs on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing genext2fs on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall genext2fs in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install genext2fs, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install genext2fs Using apt

To install genext2fs in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install genext2fs using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install genext2fs

The installation of genext2fs might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install genext2fs Using apt-get

To install genext2fs using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install genext2fs.

sudo apt-get -y install genext2fs

Install genext2fs Using Synaptic

To install genext2fs using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install genext2fs on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for genext2fs. This will display the genext2fs package in the package window, now to install genext2fs, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the genext2fs package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of genext2fs.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install genext2fs Using aptitude

To install genext2fs on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of genext2fs.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install genext2fs using the command aptitude install genext2fs.

sudo aptitude -y install genext2fs

How to Upgrade genext2fs on debian

If you want to upgrade the genext2fs package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade genext2fs using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade genext2fs to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade genext2fs.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade genext2fs sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade genext2fs

Upgrade genext2fs using Aptitude

To upgrade genext2fs using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade genext2fs.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade genext2fs

Upgrade genext2fs using Synaptic

To upgrade genext2fs using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for genext2fs, now right-click genext2fs, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade genext2fs just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall genext2fs on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall genext2fs from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just genext2fs, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove genext2fs

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of genext2fs

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of genext2fs you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge genext2fs

Remove genext2fs using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall genext2fs using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for genext2fs, right-click the genext2fs package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall genext2fs click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install genext2fs on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade genext2fs using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of genext2fs then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
